error.signature: exec format error: exec user process caused: exec format error
error.regex: exec format error|exec user process caused.*exec format

verdict.summary: The container binary is compiled for a different CPU architecture than the host (e.g., running an amd64 image on arm64), or the entrypoint script lacks a proper shebang line.

dead_ends.action: Installing QEMU without registering binfmt_misc handlers
dead_ends.why_fails: QEMU alone is not enough; the kernel needs binfmt_misc entries to know which emulator to use for foreign binaries

dead_ends.action: Forcing the entrypoint to bash without checking if bash exists in the image
dead_ends.why_fails: Many minimal images (alpine, scratch) do not include bash; use /bin/sh instead

workarounds.action: Pull the image for the correct platform architecture
workarounds.how: docker pull --platform linux/amd64 <image> (or linux/arm64 depending on your host). Check host arch with: uname -m
workarounds.condition: when the issue is architecture mismatch

workarounds.action: Add a proper shebang line to shell scripts used as entrypoints
workarounds.how: Ensure the first line of the script is #!/bin/sh (not #!/bin/bash if bash is not installed) and the file has execute permissions
workarounds.condition: when the error is caused by a missing shebang

leads_to.condition: when the exec format error is wrapped in an OCI runtime error

preceded_by.condition: when pulling the wrong platform variant of a multi-arch image

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Exec format error means the binary exists but is for the wrong architecture or lacks a shebang, while entrypoint not found means the specified binary does not exist in the container filesystem
